column3: Loanword from English. Common in sports scores (ゼロたいゼロ = 0-0).
Used in math, phone numbers, and temperatures (れいど = 0°C).
Basic number 1. Example: いちにち (one day), いっさい (1 year old).
Number 2. Example: にほん (two long objects), にじ (2 o’clock).
Number 3. Example: さんにん (three people), さんがつ (March).
Preferred reading for 4. Example: よにん (four people), よっか (4th day of month).
Number 5. Example: ごふん (five minutes), ごじ (5 o’clock).
Number 6. Example: ろっぷん (six minutes), ろくじ (6 o’clock).
Preferred reading for 7. Example: ななにん (seven people), なのか (7th day of month).
Number 8. Example: はっぷん (eight minutes), はっさい (8 years old).
Number 9. Example: きゅうじ (9 o’clock), きゅうふん (9 minutes).
Number 10. Example: じゅっぷん (10 minutes), じゅうじ (10 o’clock).
'10 + 1'. Example: じゅういちじ (11 o’clock).
'10 + 4'. Example: じゅうよっか (14th day of month).
'10 + 7'. Example: じゅうななじ (17 o’clock, 5 pm).
'2 × 10'. Example: にじゅうごさい (25 years old), にじゅうにち (20th day).
'3 × 10'. Example: さんじゅうぷん (30 minutes).
'6 × 10'. Example: ろくじゅうにん (60 people).
'8 × 10'. Example: はちじゅうえん (80 yen).
'9 × 10'. Example: きゅうじゅうにん (90 people).
100. Example: ひゃくえん (100 yen). Irregulars: さんびゃく (300), ろっぴゃく (600), はっぴゃく (800).
200. Example: にひゃくえん (200 yen).
1000. Example: せんえん (1000 yen). Irregulars: さんぜん (3000), はっせん (8000).
10,000. Example: いちまんえん (10,000 yen bill). Large numbers in Japanese group by 10,000.
100,000. Example: じゅうまんにん (100,000 people).
1,000,000. Example: ひゃくまんえん (1 million yen).
